The problem is that L2s that they own don't have a way of storing this data.
Enter proto-dunk sharding, also known as EIP4844.
The idea behind here is that we enable incredible amounts of data for these L2s to use and just for them.

We don't really care what it is.

check that this data is available.

The validators then save the data locally to their own disks.
